data.title: Beats for Good — Do Good Fest
data.meta_description: Learn how to enter Beats for Good, where local high school students compete to open Do Good Fest.
data.text:
1) Download the TikTok app from either the App Store (Apple) or Google Play (Android).

2) Open the app and create an account if you don’t already have one.

3) Tap the + button at the bottom of the screen From here, you can either record your performance directly on TikTok, or you can upload a video taken on your phone.

TIP: We suggest not putting any sound effects or filters on your video so our judging panel can see and hear you as clearly as possible.

4) Once you’ve finished recording/uploading your performance, tap “Next” at the bottom of the screen. From here, you’ll be able to post your video by clicking “Post” at the bottom of the screen.

5) After your video is posted, tap on the three dots in the bottom right hand corner of the screen.

6) From the menu that pops up, click on the blue Copy Link button.

7) Return to the Beats for Good page, hard tap on the field where you can add a TikTok link, then tap Paste.

PLEASE NOTE: Your TikTok video must be publicly accessible to be considered.

1) Go to Vimeo and in the upper right hand corner of the screen, sign into Vimeo or create an account if you don’t have one already.

2) Hover over the New Video icon in the top right hand corner of the screen, then click “Upload.”

3) Drag and drop your performance video onto the page. Once you select a file, Vimeo will automatically upload you video and save it to your channel.

4) At the top of the screen, click on the black Share button.

5) From the window that pops up, click on Copy Link.

6) Return to the Beats for Good submission form, right click on the field to share a link, then click Paste.

Once the submission period closes, a panel of local music professionals and educators will review the submissions and choose their favorites based on the following criteria:

-Stage Presence: performance is confident, memorable and engaging

-Musical Ability: performance is in tune and shows good technique

-Balance and Blend: the performance sounds well blended, no one player/instrument is standing out

-Diction: lyrics are clean, clear and understood

-Creativity:

-Covers: performer(s) adds their own creativity to give interest to the song and/or performance

-Originals: The song and lyrics are new and exciting

We’ll be sharing the top entries on this page, and visitors will be able to vote for their favorite performance. Your friends, family, and teachers will all be able to support your entry. The act who receives the most votes will win the competition.
